description: Associates the specified Amazon Web Services Systems Manager document (SSM document) with the specified managed nodes or targets. When you associate a document with one or more managed nodes using IDs or tags, Amazon Web Services Systems Manager Agent (SSM Agent) running on the managed node processes the document and configures the node as specified. If you associate a document with a managed node that already has an associated document, the system returns the AssociationAlreadyExists exception.

nested_items.name: Successful
nested_items.description: Information about the associations that succeeded.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the SSM document.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The managed node ID.

nested_items.name: AssociationVersion
nested_items.description: The association version.

nested_items.name: Date
nested_items.description: The date when the association was made.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateAssociationDate
nested_items.description: The date when the association was last updated.

nested_items.name: Date
nested_items.description: The date when the status changed.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The status.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The reason for the status.

nested_items.name: AdditionalInfo
nested_items.description: A user-defined string.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the association. Status can be: Pending, Success, or Failed.

nested_items.name: DetailedStatus
nested_items.description: A detailed status of the association.

nested_items.name: AssociationStatusAggregatedCount
nested_items.description: Returns the number of targets for the association status. For example, if you created an association with two managed nodes, and one of them was successful, this would return the count of managed nodes by status.
(string) ---
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: DocumentVersion
nested_items.description: The document version.

nested_items.name: AutomationTargetParameterName
nested_items.description: Choose the parameter that will define how your automation will branch out. This target is required for associations that use an Automation runbook and target resources by using rate controls. Automation is a tool in Amazon Web Services Systems Manager.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: A description of the parameters for a document.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The association ID.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: The managed nodes targeted by the request.
Key=tag-key,Values=tag-value-1,tag-value-2

nested_items.name: ScheduleExpression
nested_items.description: A cron expression that specifies a schedule when the association runs.

nested_items.name: OutputLocation
nested_items.description: An S3 bucket where you want to store the output details of the request.

nested_items.name: S3Location
nested_items.description: An S3 bucket where you want to store the results of this request.

nested_items.name: OutputS3Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: OutputS3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: OutputS3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket subfolder.

nested_items.name: LastExecutionDate
nested_items.description: The date on which the association was last run.

nested_items.name: LastSuccessfulExecutionDate
nested_items.description: The last date on which the association was successfully run.

nested_items.name: AssociationName
nested_items.description: The association name.

nested_items.name: MaxErrors
nested_items.description: The number of errors that are allowed before the system stops sending requests to run the association on additional targets. You can specify either an absolute number of errors, for example 10, or a percentage of the target set, for example 10%. If you specify 3, for example, the system stops sending requests when the fourth error is received. If you specify 0, then the system stops sending requests after the first error is returned. If you run an association on 50 managed nodes and set MaxError to 10%, then the system stops sending the request when the sixth error is received.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run the association at the same time. You can specify a number, for example 10, or a percentage of the target set, for example 10%. The default value is 100%, which means all targets run the association at the same time.

nested_items.name: ComplianceSeverity
nested_items.description: The severity level that is assigned to the association.

nested_items.name: SyncCompliance
nested_items.description: The mode for generating association compliance. You can specify AUTO or MANUAL. In AUTO mode, the system uses the status of the association execution to determine the compliance status. If the association execution runs successfully, then the association is COMPLIANT. If the association execution doesn't run successfully, the association is NON-COMPLIANT.

nested_items.name: ApplyOnlyAtCronInterval
nested_items.description: By default, when you create a new associations, the system runs it immediately after it is created and then according to the schedule you specified. Specify this option if you don't want an association to run immediately after you create it. This parameter isn't supported for rate expressions.

nested_items.name: CalendarNames
nested_items.description: The names or Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the Change Calendar type documents your associations are gated under. The associations only run when that change calendar is open. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Systems Manager Change Calendar in the Amazon Web Services Systems Manager User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TargetLocations
nested_items.description: The combination of Amazon Web Services Regions and Amazon Web Services accounts where you want to run the association.

nested_items.name: Accounts
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services accounts targeted by the current Automation execution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Regions
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Regions targeted by the current Automation execution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TargetLocationMaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of Amazon Web Services Regions and Amazon Web Services accounts allowed to run the Automation concurrently.

nested_items.name: TargetLocationMaxErrors
nested_items.description: The maximum number of errors allowed before the system stops queueing additional Automation executions for the currently running Automation.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRoleName
nested_items.description: The Automation execution role used by the currently running Automation. If not specified, the default value is AWS-SystemsManager-AutomationExecutionRole.

nested_items.name: TargetLocationAlarmConfiguration
nested_items.description: The details for the CloudWatch alarm you want to apply to an automation or command.

nested_items.name: IgnorePollAlarmFailure
nested_items.description: When this value is true, your automation or command continues to run in cases where we can't retrieve alarm status information from CloudWatch. In cases where we successfully retrieve an alarm status of OK or INSUFFICIENT_DATA, the automation or command continues to run, regardless of this value. Default is false.

nested_items.name: Alarms
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch alarm specified in the configuration.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of your CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: IncludeChildOrganizationUnits
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to include child organizational units (OUs) that are children of the targeted OUs. The default is false.

nested_items.name: ExcludeAccounts
nested_items.description: Amazon Web Services accounts or organizational units to exclude as expanded targets.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: A list of key-value mappings to target resources. If you specify values for this data type, you must also specify a value for TargetParameterName.
Key=tag-key,Values=tag-value-1,tag-value-2

nested_items.name: TargetsMaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run this task in parallel. This TargetsMaxConcurrency takes precedence over the StartAutomationExecution:MaxConcurrency parameter if both are supplied.

nested_items.name: TargetsMaxErrors
nested_items.description: The maximum number of errors that are allowed before the system stops running the automation on additional targets. This TargetsMaxErrors parameter takes precedence over the StartAutomationExecution:MaxErrors parameter if both are supplied.

nested_items.name: ScheduleOffset
nested_items.description: Number of days to wait after the scheduled day to run an association.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: The number of hours that an association can run on specified targets. After the resulting cutoff time passes, associations that are currently running are cancelled, and no pending executions are started on remaining targets.

nested_items.name: TargetMaps
nested_items.description: A key-value mapping of document parameters to target resources. Both Targets and TargetMaps can't be specified together.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxErrors
nested_items.description: The number of errors that are allowed before the system stops sending requests to run the association on additional targets. You can specify either an absolute number of errors, for example 10, or a percentage of the target set, for example 10%. If you specify 3, for example, the system stops sending requests when the fourth error is received. If you specify 0, then the system stops sending requests after the first error is returned. If you run an association on 50 managed nodes and set MaxError to 10%, then the system stops sending the request when the sixth error is received.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run the association at the same time. You can specify a number, for example 10, or a percentage of the target set, for example 10%. The default value is 100%, which means all targets run the association at the same time.

nested_items.name: ComplianceSeverity
nested_items.description: The severity level to assign to the association.

nested_items.name: SyncCompliance
nested_items.description: The mode for generating association compliance. You can specify AUTO or MANUAL. In AUTO mode, the system uses the status of the association execution to determine the compliance status. If the association execution runs successfully, then the association is COMPLIANT. If the association execution doesn't run successfully, the association is NON-COMPLIANT.

nested_items.name: ApplyOnlyAtCronInterval
nested_items.description: By default, when you create a new association, the system runs it immediately after it is created and then according to the schedule you specified and when target changes are detected. Specify true for ApplyOnlyAtCronInterval if you want the association to run only according to the schedule you specified.

nested_items.name: CalendarNames
nested_items.description: The names or Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the Change Calendar type documents your associations are gated under. The associations only run when that Change Calendar is open. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Systems Manager Change Calendar in the Amazon Web Services Systems Manager User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TargetsMaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run this task in parallel. This TargetsMaxConcurrency takes precedence over the StartAutomationExecution:MaxConcurrency parameter if both are supplied.

nested_items.name: TargetsMaxErrors
nested_items.description: The maximum number of errors that are allowed before the system stops running the automation on additional targets. This TargetsMaxErrors parameter takes precedence over the StartAutomationExecution:MaxErrors parameter if both are supplied.

nested_items.name: ScheduleOffset
nested_items.description: Number of days to wait after the scheduled day to run an association.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: The number of hours the association can run before it is canceled. Duration applies to associations that are currently running, and any pending and in progress commands on all targets. If a target was taken offline for the association to run, it is made available again immediately, without a reboot.
The association for which you specify a duration is cancelable according to the parameters of the SSM command document or Automation runbook associated with this execution.
The command specifies the ApplyOnlyAtCronInterval parameter, which means that the association doesn't run immediately after it is created, but only according to the specified schedule.

nested_items.name: TargetMaps

(string) ---
(list) ---
